title: Intro to ggplot2: Sales Data Heatmap
text:
Heatmap of Sales Data
This example explores relationships between expenses and income in a sample dataset.

library(tidyverse)

Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.2.3


Warning: package 'tidyr' was built under R version 4.2.3


Warning: package 'readr' was built under R version 4.2.3


Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.2.3


Warning: package 'stringr' was built under R version 4.2.3


── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.4     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(ggplot2)
library(ggthemes)

Warning: package 'ggthemes' was built under R version 4.2.3

# Read the sales dataset
sales <- read.csv("../data/sales.csv") # Make sure data/sales.csv exists!

# Create a price category
price <- ifelse(sales$unit.price > 14, "expensive", "moderate")
price[sales$unit.price < 9] <- "cheap"

# Plot heatmap
ggplot(sales) + 
  aes(x = expenses, y = income, color = price) + 
  geom_hex(bins = 50) +
  ggtitle("Heatmap of Expenses vs Income using bin2d")

title: Test R Code Execution
text:
Test Plot

library(ggplot2)

Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.2.3

ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) + geom_point()

title: Welcome to IST719 Information Visualization
text: Information visualization combines analytical thinking, design, and storytelling to make complex data understandable.

title: Welcome to IST719 Information Visualization
text: Information visualization combines analytical thinking, design, and storytelling to make complex data understandable.

title: Welcome to IST719 Information Visualization
text:
Learning Objectives

Design effective visualizations using R and ggplot2
Understand visual perception and its role in data encoding
Apply design principles to layout, color, and typography
